page.title: 16EVENTS AT TEVIOTHEAD
page.content: THE UPPER TEVIOTDALE PASTORAL SOCIETY HOLDS AN ANNUAL SHOW,THE 36TH THIS YEAR OF 1985 WHICH FOR THE FIRST TIME HAD TO BE CANCELLED DUE TO THE VERY WET SUMMER (4.97 INCHES IN JULY)AND GROUND CONDITIONS.THE SHOW IS HELD IN SEPTEMBER IN A FIELD AT FALNASH WHERE MARQUEES ARE ERECTED.THE SCHEDULE CONTAINS ENTRIES FOR:-CHEVIOT AND BLACKFACE HILL SHEEP AND INDUSTRIAL SECTIONS.JUDGES ARE APPOINTED AND PRIZES AND TROPHIES ARE AWARDED.RACES FOR CHILDREN INCLUDE WHEEL-BARROW AND THREE-LEGGED.FOUR HOUND TRIALS,KNOWN AS COURSING,ARE ORGANISED BY THE BORDER HOUND ASSOCIATION,GRETNA,WHEN MONEY BETS ARE PLACED WITH BOOKMAKERS. THERE IS A SHEEP DOG TRIAL WITH ENTRIES LIMITED TO 40, 2 DOGS PER COMPETITOR,ALSO A NOVICE DOG TRIAL IS HELD. COMPETITORS & SPECTATORS COME FROM BOTH SIDES OF THE BORDERS.
